description: Thank you so much!

It's a simple wrapper around the icloud web page.
Selecting a file and hitting the Download button doesn't do anything; so the application is almost useless, as the user cannot get any of the files displayed.
Also, if you even dare to Right-Click the app will freeze completely and you'll need to force-quit it.

At this point makes more sense to just use the webapp directly from a browser.
It's faster, safer, more compatible and doesn't break the UI & UX.
summary: Not native. It does NOT allow to download files; upload ONLY!!

description: The apps only open the specific icloud.com URL in an in-app-browser and that's it.

Yes it just opens the URL in an in-app browser. It still provides access to all your iCloud apps from your Linux desktop which is exactly what it says in the description. Don't be nit picky. Want uncompromised iCloud access buy as Mac or install macOS via vm.
Almost makes it feel like icloud is native. It is of course just a web browser window, but still great.
iCloud calendar on Linux seems almost impossible. This works

description: Good that someone packaged this in a snap! I hope to see more of this in the future. For example Office 365. NOTE: this is just for convenience since like this application; it packages a WEB Browser that then connects to the web based versions of the apps. This is fine since I personally mostly use these online anyhow since this is a more modern UI and gives access to more and better tools that integrate with the online office suites. For example: PC local spelling is poor, and online spelling services are very good. However, having the shortcuts conveniently in my menu is great! It is also GREAT that these web based office versions are SANDBOXED!

description:
I have an iPhone and an iPad, but unfortunately, i do not have a Mac. But I ever wanted to use these great Apple Apps on my Ubuntu Laptop - And thats exactly what this App does. So I recommend everybody who have Apple devices but not a Mac or using his/her Ubuntu laptop in addition to a Mac to install this App. Thanks to the Developer! 

Note: Drag & Drop between the Apps and the File Manager would be great. But thats the only thing that can be better.
its great but sadly snaps are far to slow to open

The slow startup is only just that- startup. After that(the data fills), it works efficiently for what it is- a web app. However, Nativefier is an open source app that easily transforms any web application into its own sandboxed app. No, not paid for this, nor do I belong to the distribution/development of either app. Still, this works as advertised. If you don't care to create multiple web-apps, this is good.
Slow and require internet. I'd rather just go to cloud.apple.com.
